column4: Hi there guys. I have a 300GB external FAT32 USB drive - using Ubuntu, how can I change the name of the drive, it is currently "NEW VOLUME"
you have to go into the properties of the drive, or use fdisk /dev/sda
How to I enter the properties of the drive?
just use fdisk /dev/sda and type m for the help menu and you should be able to press something in order to change the name of the volume
sorry, which switch would I use to edit the "NEW VOLUME" part?
its t once you get into the sudo fdisk /dev/hd
that might work as well, never done it that way
I tried using something called e2label and tune2fs - Neither of them support volume renaming under Fat32!?

I figured it out. There is a tool called mtools - It allows modification of volume names for FAT32 USB drives under Ubuntu. Is there any way of suggesting that this simple command actually works in the next release of Ubuntu?
good for you, i don't use FAT32 anymore
especially on this computer since i don't have this nasty thing call microcrap installed on it
